1.speaker: POLAR BEAR
1.japanese: どうしたの？　パンダくん

3.speaker: PANDA
3.japanese: 実はさ…　常勤パンダさんが
3.english: Well, you see, Mr. Full-time Panda is going back home to China for a little while so he can attend a relative's wedding.

4.speaker: PENGUIN
4.japanese: なんで　それで 元気ないの？
4.english: Why would you be down because of that?

5.speaker: PANDA
5.english: Well, you see... Since he's taking a full week off,

6.speaker: PANDA
6.japanese: 代わりにバイト　フルに 入ることになっちゃったんだよ
6.english: I have to work full-time for him that week.

9.speaker: PENGUIN
9.japanese: でも　たった１週間でしょ？
9.english: But it's only for a week, right?

11.speaker: PANDA
11.japanese: 早起きできるかな…　しかも毎日
11.english: I wonder if I can get up early, not to mention everyday.

12.speaker: PANDA
12.english: I have no faith that I can actually do it.

13.speaker: PENGUIN
13.japanese: 大変なのは早起きじゃなくて 満員電車じゃない？
13.english: I think you have to worry more about the packed trains rather than having to wake up early.

15.speaker: PENGUIN
15.japanese: 朝　会社に行く人たちで電車がいっぱいになるのが
15.english: Packed trains are when the trains become full with all the people heading to work.

16.speaker: PENGUIN
16.japanese: 僕ら　コウテイペンギンは 慣れてるからいいけど…
16.english: Us emperor penguins are used to it.

17.speaker: PANDA
17.japanese: え？　ペンギンさんも電車　乗るの？
17.english: What? You ride the trains, too, Mr. Penguin?

18.speaker: PENGUIN
18.english: No. At the South Pole, all of us huddle together and take care of the kids.

19.speaker: PENGUIN
19.japanese: もう　満員電車並みの混雑だよ
19.english: It's really tight, like a packed train.

20.speaker: PENGUIN
20.japanese: みんな おしくらまんじゅう状態だもんね
20.english: It's like playing push and shove nonstop.

23.speaker: PANDA
23.japanese: なんだか　楽しみになってきたよ
23.english: I'm actually starting to get really excited.

24.speaker: PANDA
24.japanese: 早く帰って　明日に備えなくちゃ
24.english: I need to hurry home and get ready for tomorrow.

25.speaker: PANDA
25.japanese: じゃあ…　ごちそうさま
25.english: Well then, thanks for the food!

28.speaker: PANDA
28.japanese: 急がないと 満員電車に乗れないよ
28.english: If I don't hurry, I won't be able to ride the packed train!

29.speaker: RINRIN
29.japanese: おはよう　パンダくん

30.speaker: PANDA
30.english: Good morning. Are you headed to work? Good luck!

34.speaker: GIRL
34.japanese: お花　選んでいただけますか？
34.english: Could you pick out some flowers for me?

35.speaker: PANDA
35.japanese: おしくらまんじゅうだね～
35.english: Wow, it really is like oshikura manju. The doors are closing. Please be careful. The doors are closing.

36.speaker: PANDA
36.japanese: すみません パンダ専用車両はどこですか？
36.english: Excuse me, where's the panda-only car? I don't think there is one.

37.speaker: PANDA
37.japanese: ど…　どこか… 空いてるところは…

39.speaker: ANNOUNCE
39.japanese: この先　揺れますので ご注意ください
39.english: There will be a little shaking ahead, so please be careful.

42.speaker: PANDA
42.english: Could you just put it over there?

43.speaker: HANDA
43.japanese: 朝からバイトで大変なのは わかるけどさ
43.english: I know it's tough to have to start work so early in the morning,

44.speaker: HANDA
44.japanese: もう少し　お客さんにサービスしてよ
44.english: but could you try to give the customers a little more service?

45.speaker: PANDA
45.japanese: もう　満員電車やだ…
45.english: I don't want to ride in packed trains anymore.

46.speaker: PANDA
46.japanese: 半田さん　朝代わってよ
46.english: Could you work for me in the morning instead, Mr. Handa?

47.speaker: HANDA
47.japanese: やだって言ったって 仕方ないでしょう？

48.speaker: PANDA
48.japanese: 僕　もう少し遅く来るから 朝だけパンダ代わって
48.english: I'm going to come in a little later, so could you be the panda in the morning?

49.speaker: HANDA
49.japanese: 代われって言われても　無理だし
49.english: I don't think that's going to work...

50.speaker: PANDA
50.japanese: 大丈夫　体型似てるから
50.english: You'll be fine, you're shaped fairly close to a panda.

52.speaker: HANDA
52.japanese: ありえないから 頑張ってよ　約束でしょ
52.english: It's not happening! Try to work a little harder! You promised!

53.speaker: HANDA
53.japanese: ごはん　ここ置いとくからね
53.english: I'm setting your lunch right here.

54.speaker: PANDA
54.english: Man... I'm losing my appetite thinking about the packed trains.

56.speaker: RINRIN
56.japanese: パンダくんにお届け物です
56.english: I have a delivery for you, Panda.

58.speaker: PANDA
58.japanese: いつも見てます お仕事頑張ってね
58.english: "I'm always watching you. Please keep up your best at work.

59.speaker: PANDA
59.japanese: あなたのファンより　リンリン

62.speaker: PANDA
62.english: I'm going to do my best! Mom, Mr. Panda stood up!

65.speaker: PANDA
65.japanese: もしかして　リンリンちゃん？

67.speaker: PANDA
67.japanese: リンリンちゃん　僕　頑張るからね！
67.english: Rin Rin? I'll do my best, okay? Rin Rin will be watching me.

68.speaker: PANDA
68.japanese: きっと…　あのなかに リンリンちゃんが…
68.english: Rin Rin must be somewhere in that crowd.

69.speaker: HANDA
69.japanese: ここんとこ 張り切ってるな　パンダくん

71.speaker: POLAR BEAR
71.english: Thanks for all your good work.

72.speaker: PANDA
72.japanese: 今日　常勤パンダさん 戻って来たんでしょ？
72.english: Mr. Full-time Panda came back today, right?

74.speaker: PENGUIN
74.japanese: パンダくん１日も 遅刻しなかったんだってね
74.english: I heard you weren't late once this week, Panda.

76.speaker: PANDA
76.japanese: 大切な人が見ててくれるから
76.english: Someone really dear to me has been watching me.

77.speaker: PENGUIN
77.japanese: それにしても なんかすごく疲れてない？
77.english: But it looks like you're really tired.

78.speaker: PENGUIN
78.japanese: なんだか　あちこち ボロボロで汚れてるし
78.english: You look really beat up and dirty in various places.

79.speaker: PENGUIN
79.japanese: 頑張りすぎなんじゃない
79.english: You may actually be working too hard.

80.speaker: PENGUIN
80.japanese: ゆっくり 休んだほうがいいと思うよ
80.english: I think you should take a break. I can't let her see me looking like this.

82.speaker: PANDA
82.english: I'm gonna head home. Hey! You're forgetting your Sweet Roasted Chestnut chocolates.

83.speaker: PANDA
83.japanese: 昨日もステキ 今日も頑張ってね
83.english: "You were great yesterday. Please do your best today, too!"

84.speaker: PANDA
84.japanese: リンリンちゃん　１週間　僕頑張ったよ
84.english: I worked really hard this week, Rin Rin.

86.speaker: PANDA
86.japanese: リンリンちゃん　今日も　僕が 朝からいるって思ってないかな
86.english: I wonder if Rin Rin thinks I'll be there early today, too.

87.speaker: PANDA
87.japanese: すれ違いになったら大変
87.english: It'd be awful if we just missed each other.

88.speaker: RINRIN
88.japanese: おはよう　パンダくん

90.speaker: RINRIN
90.japanese: 今日から　通常勤務じゃないの？
90.english: Aren't you going back to part-time today?

91.speaker: PANDA
91.japanese: えっ？　ああ…　うん…

92.speaker: RINRIN
92.japanese: だよね　ドキッとしちゃったよ
92.english: That's what I thought. I got scared for a moment.

93.speaker: RINRIN
93.japanese: 僕が選んだ花　気に入ってくれた？
93.english: Did you like the flowers I picked out for you?

94.speaker: PANDA
94.japanese: えっ？　ああ　リンリンちゃんのお花？ 大切にしてるよ
94.english: Oh, the flowers Rin Rin got for me? I'm taking good care of them.

95.speaker: RINRIN
95.japanese: あっ　そうだ　ちょっと 見せたいものがあるんだ
95.english: Oh, that's right! I have something I want to show you.

97.speaker: RINRIN
97.english: Look. Rin Rin's not here today? Oh, I'm Rin Rin.

99.speaker: RINRIN
99.japanese: パンダ　大好きなんだ

100.speaker: RINRIN
100.japanese: あっ　パンダくんは その中でも別格だよ
100.english: Oh, and you're one of the best, Panda!

101.speaker: RINRIN
101.japanese: リンリンズ　ベストショットは　これ
101.english: Rin Rin's best photo is this.

102.speaker: RINRIN
102.japanese: お気に入りだから 大きくしてみたんだ
102.english: It's my favorite, so I had it blown up.

103.speaker: RINRIN
103.japanese: パンダくんにもあげるね
103.english: I'll give you a copy, too.

110.speaker: PANDA
110.japanese: どうしたの？　何か考え事？
110.english: What's wrong? Is something on your mind?

113.speaker: POLAR BEAR
113.japanese: なんで　信号って 赤　青　黄色の３色なのか考えてた
113.english: I was trying to figure out why traffic lights are these three colors.

115.speaker: SASAKO
115.japanese: 違うよ　パンダくん

116.speaker: SASAKO
116.japanese: シロクマさん　カフェのスペシャルメニューを 考えてるんだよ
116.english: Mr. Polar Bear is trying to figure out a special menu for the café.

117.speaker: PANDA
117.english: A special menu? I failed the skills test again. Skills test?

118.speaker: POLAR BEAR
118.japanese: ああ　自動車教習所ね

119.speaker: PENGUIN
119.japanese: 大体　あの教官 細かすぎなんだよ！
119.english: That instructor is too picky, anyway!

121.speaker: PENGUIN
121.japanese: いやね　キョロキョロしないで まっすぐ前を見ろ！　とか
121.english: Like he was telling me, "Stop looking all over the place and watch where you're going,"

122.japanese: 慌てすぎるな！　とか

123.speaker: PENGUIN
123.japanese: ハンドルを握るときには 手を　パタパタさせるな！　とか
123.english: or "Stop flapping around so much when you're holding the wheel."

124.speaker: SASAKO
124.japanese: それは　ダメなんじゃないですか？
124.english: I think he has a point.

125.speaker: PENGUIN
125.english: At this rate, I'll never be able to

126.japanese: いつまでたってもペン子さんを　ドライブデートに誘えないよ
126.english: ask Miss Penko out on a driving date, because of that instructor.

130.speaker: PANDA
130.english: That would be an electric light {\i1}(dento){\i0}.

132.speaker: PENGUIN
132.english: I said "date!" I wonder how I can make her mine?

134.speaker: PENGUIN
134.japanese: シロクマくんなら　どうする？
134.english: What would you do, Polar Bear?

136.speaker: PENGUIN
136.english: You'd wait? I would earnestly wait.

137.speaker: PENGUIN
137.japanese: へえ～っ　なんか大人だね
137.english: Wow, you're such an adult. Yes, if you can't do that, you can't become an adult.

139.speaker: POLAR BEAR
139.japanese: ひたすら　待って　待って　待って
139.english: Earnestly wait, and wait, and wait,

141.speaker: PENGUIN
141.japanese: 射止めてないよ！ それじゃ仕留めちゃうよ！
141.english: That's not making them yours {\i1}(itomeru){\i0}! That's taking them down {\i1}(shitomeru){\i0}!

142.speaker: PENGUIN
142.japanese: シロクマくん　ちゃんと考えてよ！
142.english: Would you think about this seriously, Polar Bear?!

143.speaker: POLAR BEAR
143.japanese: ペンギンさん見てて思ったんだけど…
143.english: I just had an idea, looking at you, Mr. Penguin.

145.speaker: POLAR BEAR
145.japanese: 笹子さん　パフェフェアーは　どうかな？
145.english: How about a parfait fair, Miss Sasako?

146.speaker: SASAKO
146.japanese: パフェですか　いいですね

147.speaker: PENGUIN
147.japanese: 何それ？　デートと全然関係ないよね
147.english: What the heck? That has nothing to do with dates.

148.speaker: PENGUIN
148.japanese: どこをどうすれば　そうなるの？
148.english: How in the world did you get to that subject?

149.speaker: SASAKO
149.japanese: さっきまでスペシャルメニューの話を してたんですけど
149.english: We were just talking about making a special menu,

150.speaker: SASAKO
150.japanese: なかなか決まらなくて
150.english: but we couldn't figure out what it should be.

151.speaker: PENGUIN
151.japanese: スペシャルメニューでパフェ？
151.english: So your special menu is going to have parfaits?

153.speaker: SASAKO
153.japanese: パフェはいいですけど

154.speaker: SASAKO
154.japanese: パフェフェアーって なんか言いづらいですよね
154.english: but isn't "parfait fair" a bit hard to say?

159.speaker: POLAR BEAR
159.japanese: イチゴパフェ　バナナパフェ　チョコパフェ
159.english: Strawberry parfait, banana parfait, chocolate parfait.

160.speaker: POLAR BEAR
160.japanese: 間違いはないけど　フェアなのに 定番だけじゃつまらない
160.english: These are definitely parfaits, but it'd be boring to have just the normal lineup for the fair. Hmm, special parfaits, huh?

163.speaker: POLAR BEAR
163.japanese: をするんですよね？ メニューは決まりましたか？

164.speaker: MANDRILL
164.japanese: をするんですよね？ メニューは決まりましたか？
164.english: You're having one, right? Have you decided on the menu yet?

165.speaker: POLAR BEAR
165.english: I'm trying to decide as we speak.

166.speaker: MANDRILL
166.japanese: だったらマンドリルパフェは　どうですか？
166.english: Then how about a mandrill parfait?

168.speaker: MANDRILL
168.japanese: マンドリルなパフェです
168.english: It is a parfait that is a mandrill.

169.speaker: MANDRILL
169.japanese: それはもう　すごい迫力なんです！

170.speaker: POLAR BEAR
170.japanese: パフェに迫力はいらないかな
170.english: I don't think parfaits need intensity.

171.speaker: POLAR BEAR
171.japanese: う～ん　スペシャルなパフェね

172.speaker: LLAMA
172.japanese: シロクマさんじゃないですか
172.english: Well, if it isn't Mr. Polar Bear.

177.speaker: LLAMA
177.japanese: パフェフェアーをやるんですよね？
177.english: You're going to have a parfait fair, right?

178.speaker: LLAMA
178.japanese: ステキなパフェを思いついたんですよ
178.english: I thought up a spectacular parfait.

179.speaker: LLAMA
179.japanese: パフェなのに　とってもヘルシーなんです
179.english: It's a parfait, but it's very healthy.

182.speaker: LLAMA
182.japanese: 草　大盛りパフェです
182.english: A parfait with a large serving of grass.

183.speaker: LLAMA
183.japanese: どんなパフェかというとですね
183.english: To explain the parfait in further detail,

184.speaker: LLAMA
184.japanese: お皿の上に草がのっていてですね
184.english: there's grass on top of the plate...

186.speaker: LLAMA
186.japanese: その上に水煮の草が のっていていてですね
186.english: And on top of that, there'll be boiled grass...

187.speaker: LLAMA
187.japanese: 更に　その上に覆いかぶさるように 産地直送の草がのるんです
187.english: and then freshly delivered grass from the fields... will hang over the dish.

188.speaker: POLAR BEAR
188.japanese: いや　それすでにパフェじゃないし どっちかっていうとサラダかな
188.english: Well, that's definitely not a parfait. If you had to call it something, it'd probably be a salad.

189.speaker: POLAR BEAR
189.japanese: う～ん　スペシャルなパフェ…

190.speaker: TORTOISE
190.japanese: シロクマさ～ん　ここです！

191.speaker: TORTOISE
191.english: Please wait... I have... something to tell you.

192.speaker: POLAR BEAR
192.japanese: どうしたの？　ゾウガメさん

197.speaker: POLAR BEAR
197.english: That might be a little hard to eat.

198.speaker: POLAR BEAR
198.japanese: う～ん　スペシャルなパフェ…
198.english: Hmm, special parfaits... I wonder what would be good.

200.speaker: POLAR BEAR
200.japanese: あっ！　コアリクイくん

201.speaker: ANTEATER
201.english: I thought of... I thought of a great parfait!

202.speaker: POLAR BEAR
202.english: What kind of parfait is it? The topping is absolutely amazing!

203.speaker: ANTEATER
203.japanese: ビジュアルは黒ゴマ的ですが…
203.english: Visually, it looks like black sesame,

204.speaker: ANTEATER
204.japanese: すごく　うごめいている！

205.speaker: POLAR BEAR
205.japanese: いや　それは　いいかな

206.speaker: ANTEATER
206.japanese: だから　めちゃくちゃ　生き生きと うごめいている　黒ゴマ的トッピングの…
206.english: But they're like lively black sesame that wriggle! Japanese style is good, too, but...

207.speaker: PENGUIN
207.japanese: どうしたの？　シロクマくん

208.speaker: POLAR BEAR
208.japanese: 早く　パフェフェアーのメニュー　考えないと みんなが暴走してるから
208.english: I need to hurry up and decide on the menu for the parfait fair. Everyone's going crazy.

210.speaker: PENGUIN
210.japanese: スペシャルメニューだけに　みんな 結構　楽しみにしてるんだね
210.english: Since it's the special menu, I'm guessing everyone is looking forward to it.

211.speaker: PANDA
211.japanese: はい　は～い！　僕に　いいアイディア
211.english: Hey! I have a great idea!

213.speaker: PANDA
213.japanese: これ　これ！　竹パフェ
213.english: This is it! The bamboo parfait!

214.speaker: SASAKO
214.japanese: パンダくんに聞いて　作ってみました
214.english: I got Panda's advice and tried to make it.

216.speaker: PANDA
216.japanese: 竹ゼリーに笹クリームをのせて 新鮮な笹とタケノコをトッピングした上に
216.english: You start with bamboo jello and bamboo grass whipped cream, then top it with fresh bamboo grass and bamboo shoots,

217.speaker: PANDA
217.japanese: 刻んだ竹が いっぱい　のっかってるの
217.english: and finish it off with lots of bamboo shavings!

218.speaker: PENGUIN
218.japanese: すごく緑色なパフェだね(-_-;)

219.speaker: POLAR BEAR
219.japanese: パンダくん以外　食べないかも
219.english: I don't think anyone would eat it other than you, Panda.

220.speaker: PANDA
220.japanese: そう？ こんなに　おいしそうなのに？
220.english: Really? Even though it looks this delicious?

221.speaker: PENGUIN
221.japanese: 刻んだ竹が口に刺さりそうだよ
221.english: The bamboo shavings look like they'll stab you in the mouth.

222.speaker: PENGUIN
222.japanese: パンダくん…　パフェって言えば なんでも　パフェだと思ってるでしょ
222.english: You probably think that anything can be on a parfait, Panda.

223.speaker: PENGUIN
223.english: We can't leave it up to you.

224.speaker: PENGUIN
224.japanese: よし　ここは　僕のアイディアを…
224.english: Here, I'll throw in my idea, too.

226.speaker: PENGUIN
226.japanese: ＤＨＡたっぷり　頭もよくなる
226.english: It's full of DHA and it'll make you smart.

228.speaker: PENGUIN
228.japanese: じゃあ　今からだと 旬なアジとかでも　いいと思うよ
228.english: Well, horse mackerel are in season, too. Let's avoid fish altogether.

229.speaker: POLAR BEAR
229.japanese: なんていうか　それ パフェっていうより…
229.english: I wouldn't call that a parfait...

231.speaker: SASAKO
231.japanese: あっ！ こういうのは　どうでしょうか？

233.speaker: SASAKO
233.japanese: パンダの頭は　バニラアイスで 耳や顔は　チョコレートです
233.english: The panda's head is made with vanilla ice cream, and its face and ears are made with chocolate.

234.speaker: PANDA
234.japanese: わぁ～！　パフェになっても パンダって　やっぱり　かわいいね
234.english: Wow, pandas are cute even as parfaits!

235.speaker: SASAKO
235.english: Then there's the bear bear parfait.

236.speaker: SASAKO
236.japanese: バニラとコーヒーアイスで作ってみました
236.english: I made it with vanilla and coffee ice cream.

238.speaker: SASAKO
238.japanese: かき氷で氷山をイメージしました
238.english: I made a glacier with shaved ice.

239.speaker: GIRLS
239.japanese: すご～い！ かわいい！　新商品ですか？
239.english: Wow! How cute! Are these new?

240.speaker: SASAKO
240.japanese: あ…　いえ　試作品です
240.english: Oh no, they're test products. You're welcome to try them if you'd like.

241.speaker: GIRL
241.japanese: えっ！？　いいんですか？

242.speaker: GIRLs
242.japanese: では… いただきます！
242.english: Well then, thanks for the food!

243.speaker: GIRL
243.japanese: まずは　パンダさんから！

244.speaker: GIRL
244.japanese: じゃあ　ペンギンさんも！

245.speaker: GIRL
245.japanese: じゃあ　シロクマさんも！
245.english: And then the polar bear. I think I'll eat the nose, too.

246.speaker: GIRL
246.japanese: アハハハハ！　ひどい！！　私も　えい！
246.english: Oh, how mean! I'll have some, too.

247.speaker: GIRL
247.japanese: これ　絶対 お店で出してくださいね
247.english: Please put these on your menu! How wonderful! They're a hit.

248.speaker: THREE
248.english: Y-Yeah, great... Hey, listen to this! I failed the test again!

249.speaker: PENGUIN
249.japanese: いつも以上に大繁盛じゃない どうしたの？
249.english: This place is a lot busier than usual. What happened?

250.speaker: PANDA
250.japanese: 新メニューのフェアが大人気らしいよ
250.english: Apparently the new menu items are a hit.

251.speaker: PENGUIN
251.japanese: あぁ　パフェフェアー？

252.speaker: PANDA
252.japanese: ワンプレートランチフェア

254.speaker: PANDA
254.japanese: ペンギンさん　ペンギンさん

255.speaker: PENGUIN
255.japanese: どうしたの　パンダ君

256.speaker: PANDA
256.japanese: 何も言わないで　預金通帳もらえるかな
256.english: Without asking me the details, could I have your bank book?

257.speaker: PENGUIN
257.japanese: 嫌だってこといいかな

259.speaker: POLAR BEAR
259.japanese: 次回のしろくまカフェは

260.speaker: POLAR BEAR
260.japanese: ボルトがル語でお送りします
